result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Corbin D Romenesko was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

2:38 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given. 
Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Corbin D Romenesko in court with attorney Larry David Steen.  
Mr. Romenesko's parents are present in Court.  
Court has had a chance to review the plan that was submitted.  
Attorney Leusink has reviewed the plan and has no objection to its contents.    
Attorney Leusink makes record as to victim notification.  
Attorney Steen has reviewed it with Mr. Romenesko and he has no objection to the plan.  
Court will sign an order for the conditional release and approving the plan.  
Mr. Romenesko has an both a Probation Agent and a Social Worker.  
Court signs the initial order for placement.  
Mr. Romenesko does not have any questions.  
2:40 pm  Court in recess.  .
For Conditional Release Plan

3:36 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Defendant Corbin D Romenesko in court with attorney Larry David Steen.  
Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter is before the Court today to review the report from WCS relating to the disposition for Mr. Romenesko.  
In that report, they recommend conditional release for Mr. Romenesko.  
The State joins in that recommendation as does the Defendant.  
The Court will order that DHS prepare a conditional release plan.  
This matter will be set for further hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

NGI

Defendant Corbin D Romenesko in court with attorney Larry David Steen.  Diane M. Donohoo and Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is before the Court for a status conference.  Defendant previously entered an NGI plea and the Court ordered an Examination under Sec. 971.16.  The Doctor's report supports the Defendant's special plea.  Attorney Powell indicates the State is stipulating to the findings in the Doctor's report.  Court has plea colloquy with the Defendant.  Court has colloquy with Attorney Steen as to his client's ability to understand.  Defendant enters guilty plea to count #1.  Court finds Defendant not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect and orders defendant committed to DHS.  Court orders DHS to conduct a predisposition investigation (form CR-272) and prepare a report.  Court sets this matter for further hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
